column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
interested

James doesn't study hard. He's {{c1::more interested}} in having a good time.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
big

We need more space. We need a {{c1::bigger}} apartment.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
serious

Unfortunately the problem was {{c1::more serious than}} we thought at first.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
thin

You were always thin, but now you look {{c1::thinner}}. Have you lost weight?

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
important

Health and happiness are {{c1::more important than}} money.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
high

In some parts of the country, prices are {{c1::higher than}} in other parts.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
easily

You'll find your way around the town {{c1::more easily}} if you have a good map.

column2: Complete the sentences using the comparative. Use than where necessary.
column3:
peaceful

I like living in the country. It's {{c1::more peaceful than}} living in a town.
